item.title: Caddy golf tournament: Sonu, Vikram walk away with top spot
item.description: 50 caddies from all over the tricity and Jammu and Kashmir participated in First North India Caddy Golf Tournament . The tournament was played as a best ball format. item.title: Government College of Education celebrates International Year of Millets
item.description: The event was organised in collaboration with MGNCRE & Nivedita Foundation, propagating the use of millets. item.title: Spice of Life : Dusky is not dusty, treat black as white

item.title: Now, litigants, lawyers from Ladakh can appear for high court hearings virtually
item.description: In the first-kind-of-its-initiative, the court of Justice Tashi Rabstan on Saturday heard the matters of UT of Ladakh virtually, in which the lawyers and the government representatives, who were petitioners and respondents in the listed cases appeared on virtual mode from Leh and pleaded their cases. As many as six matters of Ladakh were listed before the bench, in which the virtual proceedings were conducted.

item.title: Weather update: Gulmarg records 13 inch snow, rains lash other parts of J&K
item.description: Kupwara and Pahalgam recorded 5cm and 2cm of snow respectively. Met director Sonam Lotus said it has been raining in most places of Kashmir, including Srinagar, and a few places of Jammu, especially the Chenab valley. Kashmir’s iconic ski resort Gulmarg received over 13 inches (35 cm) of snow while other parts of Jammu and Kashmir saw overnight rains, Met officials said on Monday.

item.title: IIT Mandi researchers develop tech which can blur out army equipment
item.description: Being invisible to radar is a crucial defence strategy and the ability to evade radar detection can reduce the chances of being targeted by enemy weapons. Any technique that makes things invisible to radar can also be used in the commercial sector to reduce radiation leakages from buildings and make them more secure. For example, invisibility to radar can also be used in private or covert establishments for the protection of information and privacy.

item.title: Congress, BJP blame each other for Himachal’s economic woes

item.title: Need major investments in energy sector: PM in B’luru
item.description: “India’s current capacity is around 250 MMTPA (Million Metric Tonne Per Annum), which is being rapidly increased to 450 MMTPA. We are indigenous, modernising and upgrading our refining industry in Kolkata. We are also working very fast towards increasing our petrochemical production capacity. You can expand your energy landscape by tapping into India’s rich technology potential and growing start-up ecosystem,” said Prime Minister Modi.

item.title: Himachal govt looking to boost Kangra as religious tourism hub: CM Sukhu
item.description: Himachal chief minister (CM) Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu said the state government is looking to develop Kangra as a tourism hub with a view to boost the local economy. Kangra has famous Hindu shrines, including Bajreshwri Devi, Jawalamukhi, Chamunda Devi, Baglamukhi, Baijnath and Mahakaal, which draw lakhs of tourists every year.

item.title: Costlier wheat hits staples; flour prices get 22% higher
item.description: In 2022, India was hoping to harvest 110 million tonne of wheat, but a prolonged heatwave around reaping time crimped output to 106.84 million tonne, about 2.5% lower than the preceding year’s 109.59 million tonne.
